TopicTitle: KSP2 Display Issues - RGB Artifacts Around Screen Border?

Articles.Content:
Hey all! As the title says, I am running into an odd issue where there is some type of artifact all the way around my screen in KSP2:

This only occurs when actually flying a rocket (from takeoff to anything in orbit, basically the launch pad loads in like shown above), it doesn't happen on the home screen, any of the load screens, or in the VAB. 

It is happening regardless of graphics settings in the game (it does the same thing on max or min settings). My base PC specs are: RTX2070 Super, i5-9600k, 32 GB ram. 

The game runs with CPU at ~50%, memory at ~50% and GPU at 100% (for all in game graphics settings), and my frame rate is pretty decent at all times.

I searched around the web and couldn't see anyone else having this same issue. Has anyone else experienced this? Does anyone know a fix?
Welcome to the forum @Boat Rower, your problem has been moved from KSP 2 Discussion to KSP 2 Tech support for better visibility.
Those artifacts have been added because you are in the simulator
That's a really cool feature and it's on purpose - to remind you that you're in the simulator.
